docs.snippet: A sharp rally in the English pound sterling, after Monday's loss of 2 cents, was the most prominent development in the foreign exchange market yesterday. Sterling bills were freely offered early in the day when the quotation was weighted down to...
docs.lead_paragraph: A sharp rally in the English pound sterling, after Monday's loss of 2 cents, was the most prominent development in the foreign exchange market yesterday. Sterling bills were freely offered early in the day when the quotation was weighted down to about 5 cents below Monday's high.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE.; Trend Is Steady Except for Sterling, Which Gains, and Lire, Which Go Lower.

docs.snippet: The Italian lira, which has figured recently in almost daily price declines, rallied 5 1/3 points yesterday, this gain having restored the quotation on about the same level as it closed last Wednesday New York buying was said to be of secondary...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Italian lira, which has figured recently in almost daily price declines, rallied 5 1/3 points yesterday, this gain having restored the quotation on about the same level as it closed last Wednesday New York buying was said to be of secondary importance. Abroad there was covering by shorts, who had sold the bill in the expectation that political agitations in Italy would cause a decline.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE.; European Bills Generally Steady Except Sterling, Which Reacts.

docs.snippet: European exchanges were generally higher yesterday. The only exception to the forward swing was found in the Italian lira, which continued to reflect the uncertain political conditions in that country. Session was a dull one, with the quiet buying...
docs.lead_paragraph: European exchanges were generally higher yesterday. The only exception to the forward swing was found in the Italian lira, which continued to reflect the uncertain political conditions in that country. Session was a dull one, with the quiet buying offsetting selling by Far Eastern banks.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE.; Italian Lira Only Exception to Forward Swing in Rates -- Session Quiet.

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges were easier all around yesterday, the Italian lira being particularly heavy and sagging to a new low on the present movement to 4.09 1/4 cents, a 5-point decline from Monday's final. Local agencies of Italian banks made an effort to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges were easier all around yesterday, the Italian lira being particularly heavy and sagging to a new low on the present movement to 4.09 1/4 cents, a 5-point decline from Monday's final. Local agencies of Italian banks made an effort to halt the reaction in the forenoon, but once this buying ceased the way was reopened for fresh selling, which forced the rate lower.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE.; Italian Lira Sags Further -- Sterling and Continentals Dull and Heavy -- Session Quiet.

docs.snippet: A sharp rally in sterling, the first in over a week since which time heavy liquidation forced its several cents under the record price in close to nine years, featured the trading in the foreign exchange market yesterday. At $4.78 5/16. London checks...
docs.lead_paragraph: A sharp rally in sterling, the first in over a week since which time heavy liquidation forced its several cents under the record price in close to nine years, featured the trading in the foreign exchange market yesterday. At $4.78 5/16. London checks showed a recovery of 2 1/2 cents from last week's low and a net gain of more than a cent over Tuesdays final.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE.; Vigorous Rally in Sterling Recovers Best Part of Last Week's Decline -- Continentals Strong.

docs.snippet: Sterling exchange staged another vigorous advance in yesterday's trading, moving up slightly less than a full 2 cents over Wednesday's final to $4.80 3-16, unequaled since March 26, 1915. Trading was very active, particularly in the forenoon, while...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sterling exchange staged another vigorous advance in yesterday's trading, moving up slightly less than a full 2 cents over Wednesday's final to $4.80 3-16, unequaled since March 26, 1915. Trading was very active, particularly in the forenoon, while the London and Continental markets remained open, but continued steady and firm in the afternoon.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE.; Principal European Bills Share in General Advance -- Strong Buying.

docs.snippet: Sails for Uruguay; urges Pan-Amer entente
docs.abstract: Sails for Uruguay; urges Pan-Amer entente

headline.main: PERSHING OFF FOR URUGUAY; General Urges Pan-American Entente on Leaving Argentina.

docs.snippet: Sterling exchange was alternately strong and weak yesterday, the first flush of buying, which was again in the hands of two prominent banks, carrying it up to $4.80 1/2, highest since March 10, 1915. The reaction, which came about midday, was the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sterling exchange was alternately strong and weak yesterday, the first flush of buying, which was again in the hands of two prominent banks, carrying it up to $4.80 1/2, highest since March 10, 1915. The reaction, which came about midday, was the result of liquidation of approximately one-half million pounds sterling by commercial interests which distributed the sales to 100,000-pound lots and broke the rate to $4.79 5/8, just before the close.
docs.abstract: Bond interest will be paid in Feb

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE.; Sterling at New High Early, but Commercial Liquidation Causes Reaction Later.

docs.snippet: Business in the foreign exchanges was small and rates only unimportantly changed yesterday. Despite the lull, the undertone had all the firmness and strength characteristic of sessions in the forepart of the week.
docs.lead_paragraph: Business in the foreign exchanges was small and rates only unimportantly changed yesterday. Despite the lull, the undertone had all the firmness and strength characteristic of sessions in the forepart of the week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE; Rates Show Little Change on Small Volume of Business -- Undertone Firm.
